body.p: includes an option to display an AI-enhanced search summary in the WebHelp search results page (at the top of the page, before the usual search results) when a user enters a search query that is identified as a question (the query contains more than two words and ends in a question mark or the query starts with an interrogative/question word). The response is generated using the AI Assistant based upon information found in the current publication.

If the AI Assistant chatbot feature is enabled, an authenticated user can continue the discussion with the AI to refine the results by using the Continue in chat button that appears below the results on the right side. When you click the button, a pop-up is displayed informing the user that conversations with the AI Assistant may be recorded and continuing means they agree to the terms. After continuing, the conversation is moved to a new dialog box where you can have a conversation with the AI Assistant to refine the results further. The content from the generated search summary (both the user's search query and the AI Assistant's reply) is displayed in the new chat dialog box to provide proper context for the continued conversation.

section.title: Enabling the AI-Enhanced Search Summary
section.p:
The AI-enhanced search summary functionality is not enabled by default. To enable it:
In the administration interface of , go to the Version Settings page for the particular version where you want semantic search enabled.
Scroll to the Content Indexing and Search section and click Edit to expand the section.
Select the Enable content indexing and Enable AI-enhanced search summary options.The AI Assistant functionality requires that you configure to connect to OpenAI on your behalf.
Click Save. The AI-enhanced Search Summary feature can generate costs. It is recommended to use support from OpenAI to configure a budget limit on the API key configured for the organization.
